questions.question: How many single stuck-at-faults can we add on a circuit with 'K' lines?

explanations.a: There are more than 'K' possible single stuck-at-faults in a circuit with 'K' lines
explanations.b: There are '2K' possible single stuck-at-faults in circuit with 'K' lines
explanations.c: There are less than 'K^2' possible single stuck-at-faults in a circuit with 'K' lines
explanations.d: There are less than 'K^3' possible single stuck-at-faults in a circuit with 'K' lines

questions.question: How many multiple stuck-at-faults can we add on circuit with 'K' lines?

explanations.a: There are more than 'K' possible multiple stuck-at-faults in a circuit with 'K' lines
explanations.b: There are more than 'K^2-1' possible multiple stuck-at-faults in a circuit with 'K' lines
explanations.c: There are a total of '3^K' combinations combinations, however since there should be more than or equal to one fault, the case of no faults can not occur, so the answer is '3^N-1
explanations.d: There are more than 'K^4-1' possible multiple stuck-at-faults in a circuit with 'K' lines

questions.question: How much data does a latch stores?

explanations.a: A latch cannot store 1 Byte of data
explanations.b: A latch can store 1 Bit of data
explanations.c: A latch cannot 4 Bit of data
explanations.d: A latch cannot store unlimited data

questions.question: Which type/types of stuck-at-faults model exhibit/exhibits the reduced complexity level of the test generation?

explanations.a: Single type/types of stuck-at-faults model do not exhibit/exhibits the reduced complexity level of the test generation
explanations.b: Multiple type/types of stuck-at-faults model exhibit/exhibits the reduced complexity level of the test generation

questions.question: For detection of stuck-at-faults in a D-Latch, can we identify the exact line of fault on every input case?

explanations.a: It is not possible to detect stuct-at-faults in a D-Latch for every case of input.
explanations.b: It is not possible to detect stuct-at-faults in a D-Latch for every case of input.
